relation: This parameter is a handle to an LDAP session returned by a successful call to DBMS_LDAP.init().
This parameter specifies the name of the directory entry to be renamed or moved.
This parameter specifies the new RDN.
This parameter specifies the DN of the new parent.
This parameter specifies whether the old RDN should be retained. If this value is 1, the old RDN is removed.
textBeforeTable: Table 9-82 RENAME_S Function Parameters Parameters RETURN PLS_INTEGER;  )  clientctrls IN LDAPCONTROL serverctrls IN LDAPCONTROL, deleteoldrdn IN PLS_INTEGER, newparent IN VARCHAR2, newrdn IN VARCHAR2, dn IN VARCHAR2, ld IN SESSION,  ( FUNCTION rename_s  Syntax Renames an LDAP entry synchronously. 9.4.31 FUNCTION rename_s      DBMS_LDAP.count_values(), DBMS_LDAP.get_values_len(). See Also count_values_len raises no exceptions. Exceptions  Indicates the success or failure of the operation.
